intro: Sida azorica, commonly known as the Azorean sida, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats. The plant has simple, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to the island's climate and is often found in open, sunny areas. Sida azorica is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
